title: Yohana Mkomola
text:
Yohana Oscar Mkomola (born 18 April 2000) is a <a href="Tanzania">Tanzanian</a> <a href="professional">professional</a> <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a> who plays in the <a href="Ukrainian%20Premier%20League">Ukrainian Premier League</a> for <a href="FC%20Vorskla%20Poltava">Vorskla Poltava</a>. 
Club career.
He was born in the Tanzanian city of <a href="Songea">Songea</a>. At a young age he went abroad, signing a contract with the Tunisian football club <a href="%C3%89toile%20Sportive%20du%20Sahel">Étoile Sportive du Sahel</a>. He spent one season in this team. On the eve of the start of the 2017/18 season, he returned to his homeland, where he became a player of the club <a href="Young%20Africans%20S.C.">Young Africans</a>. In 2018, he played two matches for Young Africans in the <a href="CAF%20Confederations%20Cup">CAF Confederations Cup</a>. In the 2018/19 season, together with the team, he became a runner-up of the <a href="Tanzanian%20Premier%20League">Tanzanian Premier League</a>.
In September 2019 he signed contract with the <a href="Ukrainian%20Premier%20League">Ukrainian Premier League</a> club Vorskla. He played for this club in the <a href="Ukrainian%20Premier%20League%20Reserves">Ukrainian Premier League Reserves</a>.
In 2020, he was sent on loan to <a href="FC%20Inhulets%20Petrove">Inhulets Petrove</a>.
International career.
He made his debut for the <a href="Tanzania%20national%20football%20team">Tanzania national football team</a> on December 9, 2017 in the lost (2:1) match of a Group A of the <a href="CECAFA%20Cup">CECAFA Cup</a> against the <a href="Rwanda%20national%20football%20team">Rwanda</a>. Mkomola came on the pitch at the 75th minute of game, replacing <a href="Yahya%20Zayd">Yahya Zayd</a>. He played 2 matches in this tournament.
